page.title: 09THURLASTON WINDMILL
page.content: The mill was last used 1910.The sails, removed in 1931 for $20 were used to make the gates of the building.They have been replaced by metal ones now. When the mill stopped they made meals. One lady remembers paying 2d for Sunday dinner and cake. The windmill has six floors including a basement.It has nine rooms,a small bedroom,living room, kitchen,dining room,study,bedroom/toilet, bathroom/toilet. Fire risk is high because it is too tall to have fire doors.On every floor there is a fire extinguisher or fire blanket. It seemed a funny place to live.It would be difficult to get furniture up the round stairs.It is also damp and hard to heat up.
